page.title: 15MEMORIES (2)
page.content: We interviewed Mr.Albert Poulter about his school days.He went to the Church school in Guithavon St. (now Howbridge CofE Junior School). It had been built in 1842,and he went there at the age of 4 1/2 in 1911 and stayed there until he was 14.The teacher took all subjects.Physical Education was a drill.There were no school dinners You either went home or ate sandwiches in the classroom.They played different games in the playground, Jimmy Knackers, Leapfrog, marbles, and Flick (with cigarette cards). He had 1 penny per week pocket money,we get 50 pence today.He said punishment was either the cane or writing lines, we have to write an essay.He only went on two school trips in the time he was there ,we have at least one each year. There were several private schools including three boarding schools. Now none left.
